item.title: Combat Calculator
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, ummm… I’m pretty sure it’s about the same.

BUT, what if there is no int in the input?
If you used parseInt(), you can put a try-catch block on it, and if an exception is thrown, you can tell the user to learn what a fucking number is.

Read full topic

item.title: Combat Calculator
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Here:

Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
int level = in.nextInt();
//Do other stuff.

That way you don’t have to worry about the Integer.parseInt() method…the scanner does it for you =]

Read full topic

item.title: Combat Calculator
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

String s = “12”
int levelInt = Integer.parseInt(s);
System.out.println(levelInt);

This will output ‘12’ to the console.

item.title: Combat Calculator
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Yes, I know this is very basic. I just recently started messing around with Java and I thought i’d post this for other beginners like me. Hopefully someone will learn something from it.


//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//Author: Exernet					//
//Title: SimpleCombatCalc				//
//Description: Calculates your Runescape combat level	//
//Website: www.exernet.co.nr				//
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

public class SimpleCombatCalc
{
public static void main(String args[])
{

double attack = 1; //Insert attack level here
double strength = 1; //Insert strength level here
double defence = 1; //Insert defence level here
double hitpoints = 10; //Insert hitpoints level here
double prayer = 1; //Insert prayer level here
double range = 1; //Insert range level here
double magic = 1; //Insert magic level here
double combat = 0;

combat = (attack*0.32707) + (strength*0.324) + (defence*0.249) + (hitpoints*0.25) + (prayer*0.124); //Calculates combat

if(magic > ((strength + attack) / 2.0)) //Calculates combat if character is mage based
combat = (magic*0.487) + (defence*0.249) + (hitpoints*0.25) + (prayer*0.124);

if(range > ((strength + attack) /2.0)) //Calculates combat if character is range based
combat = combat = (magic*0.487) + (defence*0.249) + (hitpoints*0.25) + (prayer*0.124);

//Displays combat level

System.out.println("Your combat level is: " + combat);
}
}

The combat formula may be a little off. Eventually I plan to make a GUI with text fields for level input, but at the moment I don’t understand a lot of the GUI documentation… Suggestions welcomed

Read full topic
